# News and events {.column-screen}

<!-- This kind of grid keeps the horizontal spacing nice when there's no sidebar -->
::: {.grid .column-screen .mx-2 .mx-sm-3 .mx-md-4 .my-3 .justify-contents-evenly .align-items-center}
:::::: {.g-col-10 .mx-2}
Amy Coghlan and Matt Testoni recently went on Mornings at ABC radio to talk about how the Big Fish Card Game was made, how it works, and the messages it teaches. You can listen to the episode [here](https://www.abc.net.au/listen/programs/hobart-mornings/mornings/104288814?utm_content=link&utm_medium=content_shared) (interview starts at 2:14:55).

Asta Audzijonyte also gave an interview to ABC Country Hour, which you can listen to [here](https://www.abc.net.au/listen/programs/tas-country-hour/tasmanian-country-hour/104346534?utm_content=link&utm_medium=content_shared) (interview starts at 12:55). 

Finally, check out [this article](https://au.news.yahoo.com/hunt-for-worlds-last-giant-fish-as-researchers-find-clues-in-ancient-photographs-012947944.html) on Yahoo News about how much bigger fish used to be.
